synonyms: svarūpa—Svarūpa Dāmodara Gosvāmī; sūtra-kartā—maker of short codes; raghunātha—Raghunātha dāsa Gosvāmī; vṛttikāra—maker of elaborate explanations; tāra—of those; bāhulya—more elaborately; varṇi—I shall describe; pāṅji—fluffing out (as of cotton); ṭīkā—explanation; vyavahāra—behavior.
translation: Svarūpa Dāmodara wrote short codes, whereas Raghunātha dāsa Gosvāmī wrote elaborate descriptions. I shall now describe Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's activities more elaborately, as if fluffing out compressed cotton.

purport.content: Pāṅji-ṭīkā means further explanations of a subject. Writing such explanations is likened to the process of fluffing out cotton.
